Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(City Charter Amendment - Financial and Operational Independence of the Office of
Inspector General, Office of Independent Police Monitor, and Ethics Review Board)
Race.FullText: Shall Sections 9-401 and 9-402 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans be amended and new Sections 9-403, 9-404 and 9-405 be enacted relative to the financial and operational independence of the Office of lnspector General, Office of lndependent Police Monitor, and Ethics Review Board, effective January 1, 2017: (1) to apportion funding among the three local ethics entities; (2) to establish each such local ethics entity as financially and operationally independent; and (3) to provide for annual independent external evaluation procedures for each such entity?

Race.SpecificTitle: Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement Dist. -- $150 Parcel Fee - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans impose and collect a special annual fee, called the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District fee, on each improved parcel of land in the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District (Michoud Blvd., from Adventure Dr. to Expedition Dr. (both sides), to Explorer Ave., to Voyageur Dr. and Voyageur Ct. (both sides), to Horizon Dr. (both sides) to Pierre Ct. (both sides); also Michoud Blvd.; to W. Cavelier Dr. (both sides), to Trapper Ct. (both sides), to St. Marie Ct. (both sides) and N. Cavelier Dr. (both sides)), except parcels whose owner(s) qualified for the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1), in the amount of and not exceeding one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00), for ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2017 and ending December 31, 2026, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $45,000.00 annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the security, beautification and overall betterment of Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security and services shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the district by the state, city, or other political subdivisions?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Forest Estates Improvement Dist. -- $485 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Lake Forest Estates Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual fee, to be called the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District's fee, on each parcel of taxable real property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the Parish of Orleans whose boundaries are coterminous with the boundaries of the Lake Forest Estates) as specified by Resolution R-16-122 of the City Council of New Orleans in the amount of Four Hundred Eighty-Five dollars ($485) annually for eight (8) years, beginning January 1, 2019 and ending December 31, 2026, with an estimated $95,338.00 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year, to be used solely and exclusively for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the District, except a 1% City collection fee, as determined and managed by the Board of Directors of the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District which security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Vista Crime Prevention Dist. -- $220 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Lake Vista Crime Prevention District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans renew the special annual "Lake Vista Crime Prevention District Parcel Fee," on each improved or unimproved single- and two-family residential parcel and each multiple-dwelling or apartment parcel located within the Lake Vista Crime Prevention District (which district is located within and including the following perimeter: Robert E. Lee Boulevard (interior side), Marconi Drive (interior side), Beauregard Avenue (interior side), and Lakeshore Drive (interior side)), in the amount of not to exceed two hundred twenty dollars ($220) per parcel annually for four (4) years starting January 1, 2017 and ending December 31, 2020, which fee is estimated to generate approximately one hundred sixty-five thousand dollars ($165,000) annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the security of the Lake Vista Crime Prevention District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Vista Crime Prevention District, which additional security patrols (public or private) or any other security or other services or betterments provided by the district shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the district by the City, State or by other political subdivisions?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lakeshore Crime Prevention Dist. -- $360 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy and collect the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District parcel fee on each improved or unimproved parcel located within the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District (the "District") in the amount of and not exceeding three hundred sixty dollars ($360.00) annually, for four (4) years beginning January 1, 2017 and ending December 31, 2020, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $236,520 annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security and services shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?
